summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, setting a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, and establishing a schedule for jury selection procedures including juror questionnaires, voir dire, and pretrial conferences.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order setting the trial date and procedural schedule.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The jury trial in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for an in-person pretrial conference.

events.title: Court Informs Parties of Tentative Trial Date
events.description: The court informed the parties it had set a tentative trial date for November 29, 2021.

events.title: Court Sets Schedule
events.description: The court set a schedule on this date, which is amended by the current order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was firmly scheduled to commence on November 29, 2021.
Jury selection procedures included juror questionnaire administration on November 4, 5, and 12, and voir dire on November 16-19, 2021.
The order establishes deadlines for the parties to submit joint proposals for juror questionnaires, voir dire, jury charges, and verdict sheets.
The schedule was amended from a previous order dated June 2, 2021, due to the confirmation of the firm trial date.
The proceedings were subject to COVID-19 protocols affecting courtroom space and public access.
